title.narrative: Reduction of Economic and Human Loss and Displacement by Natural Disasters through Community-Based Resilience-Building and Strengthened Protection Measures for Internally Displaced Persons in Papua New Guinea

description.narrative: The project contributes to the reduction of economic and human loss and displacement caused by natural hazards through targeted interventions in Papua New Guinea (PNG). This is being accomplished through addressing four core areas: (a) assisting the government of PNG at the national and provincial levels to prepare for and respond to disasters; (b) institutionalization of the Disaster Risk Management strategy and standard operating procedures for the national to all sub-national levels; (c) enhancing community-based early warning systems and facilitating community-based disaster risk management (CBDRM) planning at the community level to help at-risk communities prepare for, mitigate and respond to natural disaster risks; and (d) supporting small-scale disaster risk reduction and resilience building projects identified at the community level through the CBDRM planning process that promote gender empowerment and address drivers of gender-based violence. A cross-cutting issue in all aspects of the project will be the involvement of women in disaster risk reduction.
